page.title: 07HEVERSHAM HALL (continued)
page.content:
comes.
The farm has l50 sheep, two ponies, three sheep dogs and 3 cats. Mr. and Mrs. Handly rent 275 acres which is mostly grazing land. Down near the estuary it is fertile soil so they plant crops of potatoes, barley and silage. The fields on Heversham Head are good for sheep grazing. It is not good for crops because there is not sufficient depth of soil.
The farmhouse has still the Great Hall which is the coldest part of the house. In the l7th century beams were put across to make an upper floor. The farmhouse once had two pele towers, but these have fallen down. Many extentions have been made over the years to the farmhouse.
